column4: hi all! hey 1 question, is there any way to load a manpage in other lang without changing environment vars? Something like man --lang=french ls
look at what type of partition you have
and then simply mount it
man man suggests using the -L <locale>   --locale=<locale> switch
ouch.. that sounds painful.. there has to be good books out there about bash.. it's been around for a while
can't even read the man.. I would say that managing to read the entire man page is a big feat indeed.. reading a book about bash sounds much more pleasant
man pages are available as html-files as well.. perhaps that's easier on the eyes?
I would go with something like this http://oreilly.com/catalog/9781565923478  (I'm not familiar with that book myself.. that's just an example)
you're welcome
two keys? you mean why there is one public key and one private key?
oh.. didn't know it did that... you've installed the standard gpg package?
yeah hehe
type of process ? what do you mean by type? they are all processes
there are several tools to list your processes, top or htop for the terminal.. then there's the system monitor in system, administration
afaik sockets or pipes aren't processes.. a daemon is a normal process afaik
if you want to list open ports and such there's "netstat"
try to explain what you're trying to do
i'm trying to know if a program is running as daemon or not
top does that work, so i thought some simpler program can do it too
how do you see if a process is a daemon in "top" ?
afaik a daemon is just a regular process that runs in the background.. ie it's not under direct user control..  some daemons have a special parent process.. but that's not necessary either
you're welcome
just describe your problem
